ghostPost.meta_title: Link Roundup, April 19th | Hackers and Slackers

authors.name: Matthew Alhonte
authors.bio: Super villain in somebody's action hero movie. Experienced a radioactive freak accident at a young age, which rendered him part-snake and strangely adept at Python.

primary_tag.name: Roundup
primary_tag.description: Subscribe to our daily roundups of top data science news articles, slimmed down to only the good stuff.

ghostPost.plaintext:
Useful little rundown!

https://www.analyticsvidhya.com/blog/2018/04/fundamentals-deep-learning-regularization-techniques

I really, really like the idea of eventually doing data stuff in Clojure.
 Python's got some fundamental issues with scalability, and R's not really
better in that regard.  Clojure's a joy to code in, and the fact that it targets
the JVM means that a good set of bindings to Spark (+ friends) would probably be
able to keep pace better than the Python bindings (which are excellent, but I've
come across times where I'd have to drop into Scala, which I don't know and
seems more intimidating than a friendly Lisp).

https://github.com/hswick/jutsu.ai

https://www.quantamagazine.org/how-many-genes-do-cells-need-maybe-almost-all-of-them-20180419/

Technology's cool

https://spectrum.ieee.org/geek-life/profiles/why-your-gps-receiver-isnt-bigger-than-a-breadbox

Friendly breakdown of how we got here!

https://www.kdnuggets.com/2018/04/derivation-convolutional-neural-network-fully-connected-step-by-step.html

http://wesmckinney.com/blog/announcing-ursalabs/

Sounds exciting!  Especially if it turns into a better model for Open Source to
sustain itself.

https://www.quantamagazine.org/new-brain-maps-with-unmatched-detail-may-change-neuroscience-20180404/

Meanwhile, in Scotland...

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/apr/19/very-angry-badger-causes-part-of-scottish-castle-to-be-closed-to-public

https://www.quantamagazine.org/ultra-accurate-clocks-lead-search-for-new-laws-of-physics-20180416/

https://medium.com/applied-data-science/how-to-build-your-own-world-model-using-python-and-keras-64fb388ba459

An AI got trained to turn a script into a cartoon.  This, when combined with
that DeepFake thing Jordan Peale used to make that fake Obama PSA, is definitely
going to cause the end of the world.  Exciting!

https://arxiv.org/pdf/1804.03608.pdf

I'm into anything that can be summarized as "Do X, except in one function call".

https://medium.com/@keeper6928/mltest-automatically-test-neural-network-models-in-one-function-call-eb6f1fa5019d

https://hackernoon.com/ethereum-smart-contracts-in-python-a-comprehensive-ish-guide-771b03990988

Hashtag Goals:
